question.title: Switch Statement
question.content:
Given a number, you have to use a switch statement to return "One" if the given number is equal to 1, "Two" if the number is 2 and so on till 9 ("Nine") else return "Unknown"(without quotes). 

Examples:

Input: number = 10
Output: Unknown
Input: number = 1
Output: One

hints:
Java:

Inside switch(number) create case 1 in which we will print one and also create default case in which we will print Not One.

CPP:

Inside switch(number) create case 1 in which we will print one and also create default case in which we will print Not One.


â€‹C:

Inside switch(number) create case 1 in which we will print one and also create default case in which we will print Not One.
